page.title: 02Clevedon by Katy Douch age11
page.content: Clevedon is not a city and yet it is not a village.It is a town which is growing all the time.Clevedon is between Bristol (a large city) and Weston-super-Mare (a holiday resort). It is built on three different levels: the hills,the flat lands and the slopes in between.The houses are all different types.There are Georgian, Victorian and modern day homes.New houses and estates are being built all the time.There are two shopping areas:the Triangle and Hill Road.At Clevedon we have a Victorian pier.It collapsed a few years ago and is now being rebuilt.We also have Walton Castle,which is private so you can't go and visit it. There are lots of open spaces and wooded areas in Clevedon....so it is great to just go off and be able to get away from the hustle and bustle.
